title: Ancestry.com not working entirely with the latest update of Firefox browser
content: Just FYI... for the past few days, I've noticed that my Ancestry.com DNA Matches will not open in Firefox on multiple Windows computers. This function works fine in Chrome on the same computers. In Firefox, the rest of the Ancestry website works without problems. I can navigate to the DNA Matches page where it shows Paternal, Maternal, etc., but when I click on the "View Matches" button, only the header and footer information shows up on the resulting page -- no DNA match data appears. It's almost like the Javascript, or whatever they use, isn't firing. I tried texting Ancestry, and their automated response suggested downloading the latest version of Firefox. I've already done that (version 110.0.1 (64-bit)). I don't know if this problem belongs to you or if it's large enough for you to worry about, but it's annoying to me and I'll have to switch to another browser if this can't be resolved. I'd prefer to stay with Firefox. I didn't notice this problem until the past few days (or maybe a week) or so. I'm wondering if it's anything related to your latest update(s)? Thanks!
creator: dtstaley57

title: Extensions are installed but don't appear in toolbars (v. 110.0.1). Estensiones no aparecen en barras de herramientas
content: Después de instalar la v. 110.0.1 las extensiones instaladas no se ven en las barras de herramientas, han desaparecido. Restablecí Firefox y las instalé de nuevo y no aparecen. Solo aparece Keepass y Privacy Badger, como se puede ver en la captura de pantalla adjunta. Gracias por su ayuda.
creator: yinyong

title: How to give feedback for extensions?
content:
Hi!

There is no way to give any feedback eve tough I am logged in. As you can see from screenshot. I can only read others. Could someone share here screenshot showing where to find some button/form to leave a feedback?

PS if you are FF website maintainer then for your information: It is a bad design if people need tutorial on how to leave a feedback.
creator: wybqogzigoxruxdhnp

title: View image info without extra request
content:
Hi!

Is it possible to configure firefox so that when I right click image and choose view image info it would not request that image again from server but rather look it up from already downloaded resource? In some cases it can be a problem or even deal breaker if that feature has to make new request just re-download what has already been downloaded.
creator: wybqogzigoxruxdhnp

title: Breaches - Sites I don't have accounts on for approx 99% of them listed
content: Hi there, I was looking through the breach list you all have for my email address and am a bit confused. The companies listed except for a couple are all ones that I do not have accounts on so I don't understand how I ended up on a breach list. Are you able to explain this further and when you reply, would you mind not sending a reply that I cannot reply to if I still have a question (or if the replies are generated with that type of email in the reply field would you mind including an email address that I can reply to so that the individual reading my follow-up question doesn't have to begin from the beginning with my submitting another support request like this but can see what has already been addresses and then hopefully wrap it up? Thanks so much!
creator: tara7175
